data.title: What you need to know about Zurich Christmas Markets in 2024: The Only Zurich Travel Guide You Need!
data.meta_description: If Zurich Christmas markets aren't on your bucket list, let me show you why they need to be! My Zurich guide is filled with Christmas magic.
data.text:
I’ve indulged in some twinkly, fondue-drenched Switzerland Christmas markets experiences, but the Zurich Christmas markets are pretty impressive! Zurich is already drop-dead gorgeous, right? But you add some Christmas lights, a Christmas tree composed of Swarovski crystals, and adorable wooden market stalls scattered throughout the city centre, and voila! You’ve got yourself a winter wonderland fit for a Snow Queen or King!

If you needed an excuse on the best things to do in Zurich in December, you’ve come to the right place because this guide covers everything you need to know about the Zurich Christmas markets. That’s not all though! I will be covering where to stay, what to do and of course what to eat while you’re in Zurich!

Best Zurich Christmas Markets (VIDEO)

We took an incredible trip to Zurich in 2019! Well, take a look at the video of our adventure and see for yourself why this place stole our hearts. Trust me, from the stunning Christmas decorations to the jaw-dropping streets, Zurich has got it going on. It’s like a real-life fairytale that you won’t want to leave.

@herjoliejourney Switzerland is truly magical during the holidays, but we wish we could have seen even more Christmas markets and activities. And the high prices didn’t help. #europechristmas #christmasmarkets #europetravel #christmastravel #photospots #zurichchristmas #zurichtravel #visitzurich #visitswitzerland ♬ The Christmas Song - Shawn Mendes & Camila Cabello

Things to know before visiting Zurich Christmas Markets

If you’re to looking to add the Zurich Christmas Market to your holiday itinerary, I’ve got your back with some key deets you need to know! From the best time to visit to the tastiest treats you can eat, I’ve got all the insider info to make your trip merry and bright. So put on your cozy holiday sweater and get ready to soak up the festive vibes at one of the world’s biggest and best Christmas markets. Yule love it!

So How Do You Get To Zurich Exactly

Zurich, the land of a million and one ways to get there! There’s no need to stress about your arrival because this transport and travel hub is ready to welcome you with open arms. The closest airport to this Swiss wonderland is the Zurich Airport where most major international airlines are buzzing through like bees. And guess what? It’s only a jawdropping 12-minute train ride from the city center.

If trains are your thing, Hauptbahnhof is one of the busiest in Switzerland (if not THE busiest), with frequent connections to other cities around Europe. You can find the best rates here.

Best Time to Visit Zurich

Who needs a “summer bod” when you can have a “gingerbread bod”, am I right? The Zurich Christmas markets are next-level insane and December is the prime time to experience it all. Plus, you’ll save some serious money because it’s not peak tourism season. So ditch the sunscreen and grab your warmest coat because it’s time to get festive in one of the most gorgeous cities in the world. Twinkling lights and all!

Is Public Transport in Zurich Easy To Use

Need to get around Zurich without sweating? Just snap up a Zurich Card and you’re good to go! The Card lets you hop on and off public transport without spending a dime – yes, even from the airport. That’s not all though – you get discounted entry to some of the best sights in the city. Who said travelling is expensive?

Speaking of public transport, you’d be impressed by Zurich’s network – it’s so well connected that it puts other cities to shame. And don’t worry if you’re new to the scene. The city makes it simple as pie for tourists to use public transport. If you’re still feeling apprehensive, try the Zürich City Guide app.

When do Zurich Christmas markets start [Updated 2024]

Looking to visit the land of cheese and chocolate this Christmas? Well, you can’t go wrong with Zurich, the largest city in Switzerland! With its stunning historic old town, beautiful Lake Zurich, and majestic snow-capped mountains, you’ll feel like you’re in a winter wonderland!

What better way to experience it all than by visiting the Zurich Christmas Market and Advent events?! They’ll be popping up all over the city from late November until New Year’s Eve, complete with festive food, mulled wine, and plenty of opportunities to shop for unique presents. So mark your calendar, pack your winter essentials, and get ready to jingle all the way to Zurich! Most Zurich Christmas Market will be open from late November to late December 2024. Final dates TBD.

This Switzerland Christmas Market Food Will Make You Drool

Switzerland is bringing some seriously tasty holiday traditions to the table! Get ready to drool because there’s a mouth-watering variety of Christmas delicacies that can be found at the Zurich Christmas markets, and I’ve got the inside scoop on the dishes that’ll have you craving seconds.

Swiss Chocolate: Don’t be a fool and miss out on indulging in the country’s most notorious chocolate bars. And trust us, when it comes to the chocolate game, Lindt is the Michael Jordan of Swiss chocolate. So grab a few bars (or ten, we won’t judge) during your stay and experience pure chocolate bliss!

Fondue: Mountains, chocolate, and ooey-gooey cheesy goodness – what more could a person want? Don’t even try to deny the allure of this masterpiece dish, complete with the finest cheese known to humankind. Trust me, it’s worth every extra calorie and loaf of bread you’ll need to consume. And let’s be real here, there’s nothing quite like that moment when you plunge your bread into piping-hot cheese and feel like you’ve unlocked some kind of cheesy nirvana.

Sausages: Fuel your festive adventure with the perfect on-the-go grub–sausages! And don’t worry about catering to all diets- vegans and vegetarians can chow down too! Grab a bun and saunter through the stalls.

Öpfelchüechli: Think crispy apple fritters so delightful that they’ll make you forget your name. These fritters are a Zurich classic that are worth every calorie.

65h Cider Steak: The Zurich Christmas Market’s 65h cider steak is this beef beauty that is cooked in cider for a solid 24 hours, and then topped with caramelized onions for ANOTHER 30 HOURS. Talk about a committed relationship! Don’t miss out on this indulgent experience at the Wienachtsdorf in Sechseläutenplatz.

Grittibanz (think cute Swiss Christmas Bread): Check out these bread men, or as the Swiss call them – Grittibanz! Did you ever think dough could be so darn adorable? These little guys are so cute you may want to adopt them as pets instead of eating them. But let’s be honest, we all know they’re too delicious to resist.

Best Hotels to stay in Zurich Switzerland

Want to be where the Christmas market action is in Zurich? Look no further than these hotel options. They’ll have you right in the middle of all the festive fun, so you can be in the center of all the holiday cheer while you enjoy the convenience of these accommodations.

Zurich Marriott Hotel

PRICE: $$$

GOOGLE RATING: 4.3

ADDRESS: Neumühlequai 42, 8006 Zürich, Switzerland

Looking for a hotel that’s the whole package? The Zurich Marriott Hotel has you covered. Not only is it just a quick 10-minute drive from the airport, but it’s also a mere 5-minute walk from the main station — so you can get there fast…and then relax in style. With its jaw-dropping views of the lake, fabulous decor, and top-notch service, this place is the definition of Swiss sophistication. And did we mention it’s pet friendly, too?

Ruby Mimi Hotel & Bar

PRICE: $$

GOOGLE RATING: 4.5

ADDRESS: Beatenpl. 4, 8001 Zürich, Switzerland

Looking for a spot that oozes vintage Hollywood vibes? Look no further than Ruby Mimi! Nestled in the shell of one of Zurich’s earliest movie theaters, this 24-hour bar is a true celebration of cinema’s golden age. With plenty of vintage cameras and costumes to feast your eyes on, Mimi is the perfect spot for movie buffs. Plus, its location just a stone’s throw from Zurich’s main station makes it a breeze to get to.

Storchen Zürich

PRICE: $$$$

GOOGLE RATING: 4.6

ADDRESS: Weinpl. 2, 8001 Zürich, Switzerland

This 5-star Hotel is located in the most spectacular place right on the Limmat River in Zürich’s charming Old Town. It’s one of the few hotels where you can sip your morning coffee while enjoying the breathtaking view of the river. With the Bahnhofstraße boutique shopping avenue, the financial district and the Grossmunster Cathedral just a short stroll away, you’ll never be bored. The cherry on top? This luxurious Storchen Hotel offers a complimentary breakfast service.

Best Things to do in Zurich in December

Get ready for a spectacular time in Zurich’s Old Town! Zurich’s neighborhoods are bustling with activities that can fit any schedule. With so many options, you might just need some guidance to help you sift through the options. Lucky for you, I’ve got an insider’s list of the best things to do in Zurich in December.

Get ready to time-travel to the Middle Ages in Altstadt, aka Old Town, where you can stroll around and explore surprising medieval homes, renaissance-era town halls, and whimsical winding streets. It’s like stepping into a history book, but without the dusty pages. Don’t miss out on the big-league Grossmunster towers – the most iconic spot in Zurich. You can also check out Peterskirche and its majestic (literally) clock face – Europe’s largest one! Beat that, Big Ben!

And let’s talk about the real reason we’re here: FOOD. Altstadt’s dining scene is every foodie’s dream come true. Breakfast, lunch, or dinner – they’ve got it covered with a plethora of must-try spots.

If you’re seeking an Insta-worthy lookout over Zurich that’ll make you say “peak” perfection, then climb aboard the Uetliberg express! At 2,850 feet high, this spot serves breathtaking cityscape and mind-blowing mountain views, plus just wait until the winter season! The snow transforms the mountain into the coolest winter playground around. Sled downhill until you see stars! You can rent a sled here.

Are you a self-proclaimed chocoholic? Look no further than the Lindt Home of Chocolate – the ultimate Zurich destination for your sweet tooth! This playful museum is chock-full of unique experiences, like gazing up at a 30-foot chocolate fountain and shopping at the largest Lindt store in the world.

But the real treat? The Lindt Chocolateria, where you can create your very own delicious chocolate creations. Get crafty and whip up gourmet chocolate bars, complete with all sorts of delectable toppings, or challenge yourself to make delicate chocolate figures and pop-worthy lollipops. With so much chocolatey goodness to explore, the Lindt Home of Chocolate is a must-visit for anyone with a taste for the sweet life.

“Are you freezing your butt off? Fear not! Zurich’s got over 50 museums to keep you toasty and entertained. From art galleries to history exhibits, you’ll definitely find something to love. So why not take shelter from the storm and dive deep into Zurich’s culture? Here are some of the top rated museums and art galleries:

National Museum Zurich

Museum Rietberg

Kunsthaus Zurich

Museum of Design

Zurich Tram Museum

FIFA World Football Museum

Picture yourself gliding on ice like a swan. Winter in Zurich isn’t complete without ice skating! Lucky for you, there are tons of rinks around town, both indoors and outside. But let’s be real, the Dolder open-air ice rink is the diamond in the rough. It’s massive, beautiful, and attracts ice skaters of all levels. You can hit up this winter wonderland any day of the week (with varying hours, so check ahead), and skate rental is included in your entrance fee.

Zurich Christmas Markets You Don’t Want to Miss!

Zurich is considered one of the best Switzerland Christmas markets, and definitely one you DO NOT want to miss! From traditional markets to cool pop-up bars, this city is bursting with festive energy. Not to mention, the designer shopping and lively ambiance will have you feeling like Santa himself. Experience all that Zurich has to offer during the holiday season.

INSIDER TIP: the Christmas markets found here have different opening hours, and it can get confusing but i’ve got all the information you need to visit each Christmas market here!

Wienachtsdorf at Sechseläutenplatz

2024 TBD

Monday to Thursday: 11.00am – 11.00pm, Friday and Saturday until 12.00am, Sunday until 10.00pm

ICE RINK HOURS: Monday to Friday, from 11.00am

Get your jingle on at Sechseläutenplatz – the home of one of the biggest Christmas markets in Zurich! This was our FAVORITE Christmas market, not just because it’s next to the beautiful Opera House and Lake Zurich, but because this spot just oozes Christmas magic. With over 100 stalls, this festive wonderland is a non-stop party against the stunning backdrop of the Opera House. Whether you’re looking for unique gifts or feeling a little peckish, this Christmas village has got you covered.

Christkindlimarkt at Zurich Central Station

2024 TBD

Sunday to Wednesday: 10.30am – 9.00pm, Thursday to Saturday: 10.30am – 10.00pm

This Christmas wonderland will still sweep you off your feet!!! Why, you ask? Let’s start with the 50ft tall Christmas tree shimmering in Swarovski crystals! That’s right!! 50 FEET!!!

And that’s not all – this market has over a hundred stalls with special goods and delicious Christmas treats. And let’s not forget about the twinkling lights and Christmas tree – it’s like being transported into a snowy fairytale!

Werdemühleplatz Christmas Market

2024 TBD

Monday to Thursday: 4.00pm – 9.00pm, Friday: 4.00pm – 10.00pm, Saturday: 1.00pm – 10.00pm, Sunday: 1.00pm – 9.00pm

CHOIR PERFORMANCES: Monday to Friday: 5:30pm / 6:30pm, Saturday and Sunday: 2:30pm / 3:30pm / 5:30pm / 6:30pm

If you’re looking for a truly magical Christmas experience, look no further than the Werdmühleplatz market! We stumbled across this cute little courtyard when we heard the sweetest little voices singing and were pleasantly surprised to find a Singing Christmas Tree! Since ’98, this tree-shaped stage has played host to the best choirs from across Switzerland, spreading holiday cheer to all who stop by.

You’ll be transported to a winter wonderland of starry lights and delightful carols. So, grab a mug of hot cocoa and cozy up to the sounds of angels singing – this is a Zurich Christmas market you won’t want to miss!

The Zurich City Christmas Market

2024 TBD

Monday–Saturday: 10am – 8pm, Sunday: 11am – 7pm

This charming market is nestled between the giants of Jelmoli and Globus department stores. And boy, is it tempting! Surrounded by rustic wooden chalets and twinkling Christmas lights, it’s a shopper’s paradise. You won’t be able to resist the unique handicrafts found here. And don’t worry if you start to feel hungry, you can find some good food here to keep the hangar away!

Dörfli Weinachtsmarkt im Niederdorf

2024 TBD

Monday to Saturday: 11am – 9pm (food stands until 10pm), Sunday: 11am – 7pm (food stands until 8pm)

Get ready to ditch your dull surroundings and head to the OG Christmas market in Zurich! The Dörfli Christmas Market is where all the magic happens, so get ready to be whisked away to a winter wonderland in the charming Old Town. Along with stunning pastel-colored buildings and festive storefronts, the ski gondolas have even been turned into cozy fondue spots. You’ll be living a fairytale in no time!

This market is spread out across multiple squares, including Zwingli Space, Stüssihoffstatt, Rosenhof, Niederdorfstrasse, Hirschenplatz, and around the Grossmünster. So, channel your inner Santa Claus and make sure you hit up all the stops!

I hope this guide helps you make the most of your time at the Zurich Christmas Markets! And while you’re here, make sure to check out my guide on the Best Christmas Markets in Lucerne here.
